sources.title: Jack London
sources.description: The film follows the adventures of the writer Jack London (Michael O'Shea) who was, among other things, oyster pirate, hobo, sailor, prospector and war correspondent.

sources.title: Jack London (1943) MICHAEL O'SHEA ♥ SUSAN HAYWARD
sources.description:
PizzaFLIX Presents CLASSIC MOVIE MONDAY
Stars: Michael O'Shea, Susan Hayward, Louise Beavers
Co-Stars: Virginia Mayo, Ralph Morgan, Regis Toomey
Director: Alfred Santell

A Hollywood biopic starring Micheal O’Shea as the rugged fortune hunter, war correspondent, animal rights activist, and renowned novelist JACK LONDON. The film focuses on his love life and co-stars Virginia Mayo, Osa Massen, and PizzaFLIX prom queen SUSAN HAYWARD.

TRIVIA: based on the biography written by Jack London's wife Charmian, portrayed by Susan Hayward in the film.

sources.title: Jack London (1943) Adventure, Biography, Romance, Full Length Movie
sources.description:
Jack London was an American novelist, journalist and social activist.  This movie tells of his various  adventurous life before he became an accomplished writer (1876-1916).

Director: Alfred Santell
Writers: Charmian London, Ernest Pascal 
Stars: Michael O'Shea, Susan Hayward, Osa Massen
Genres: Classics, Adventure, Biography, Romance, War

metadata.Plot: Episodes in the novelist's life: In 1890, young Jack London quits a cannery job to try oyster piracy. Later, he signs on for a sealing voyage, tries Yukon prospecting and a brief university career, loving and leaving women along the way. Instead of riches, he gets story ideas. Suddenly, he finds success and a delectable lady; but the urge to adventure won't let him go.
metadata.Writer: Charmian London, Ernest Pascal, Isaac Don Levine
metadata.Actors: Michael O'Shea, Susan Hayward, Osa Massen
